title: NFC sharing for Course and Profile Fragments
message:
NFC sharing for Course and Profile Fragments

Note: Currently we share whatever is on the screen, be it a friend’s
Profile or yours. The alternative is to always share the logged-in
user’s profile if they are on any Profile screen.

Also, we’re currently using intent filters to handle NFC intents so
that we can trigger our choice of Activity (MainFlowActivity) rather
than the application default (LoginActivity). I mention this because
someone who touches this NFC code in the future may be inclined to use
Android Application Record (AAR) in the NFC push messages
(NDefMessage). This is not what we want, at least in it’s current
implementation (API 18) because “AARs are only supported at the
application level, because of the package name constraint, and not at
the Activity level as with intent filtering.” (quoted from
http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/connectivity/nfc/nfc.html#aar)
. In other words, specifying AAR means opening the LoginActivity when
we receive a Flow NFC event.

title: Speed up FLowDatabaseLoader a bit
message:
Speed up FLowDatabaseLoader a bit

... by wrapping batch createOrUpdate calls in dao.callBatchTasks, as advised by
http://stackoverflow.com/a/11762104/392426

We still get thrashing though when saving all the profile data on initial load.
Ideally, we should be rendering data before saving to the database, but
alternatively we should also take the user to their profile page as soon as
possible.

title: Remove private constructor on fragment
message:
Remove private constructor on fragment

This was causing the following error:

> java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{com.uwflow.flow_android/com.uwflow.flow_android.MainFlowActivity}: android.support.v4.app.Fragment$InstantiationException: Unable to instantiate fragment com.uwflow.flow_android.fragment.CourseFragment: make sure class name exists, is public, and has an empty constructor that is public
```

It seems like fragment ctors should not be overriden:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10450348

Thanks @w2ji for reporting.

title: Potential fix for fragment overlapping issue
message:
Potential fix for fragment overlapping issue

The culprit could be our use of
FragmentTransaction.add(..) rather than .replace(..) in our
MainFlowActivity.OnCreate(). This has now been switched to
.replace(..). I have also added a conditional around the instantiation
and transaction of the fragment in MainFlowActivity.OnCreate() in case
we having the following:
app is opened -> killed by the system due to memory shortage -> resumed
(i.e. via task switcher), thus running MainFlowActivity.onCreate again

Our issue *sounds* identical to the one described here:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17126135/android-fragment-screens-ove
rlap

title: Force portrait orientation
message:
Force portrait orientation

We currently don't correctly handle orientation changes -- the app will crash.
All of our screens are also designed to be viewed on portrait. Only the schedule
image might benefit from landscape. So, just disable landscape orientation for
now to get us closer to shipping.
